profileText: a Representative from Texas; born on February 2, 1980; graduated from Bellaire High School, Bellaire, Tex., 1998; B.A., University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, N.C., 2002; M.P.P., Duke University, Durham, N.C., 2006; teacher; policy analyst; nonprofit executive; member of the Harris County, Tex., department of education, 2013-2019; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Eighteenth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Sheila Jackson Lee (November 5, 2024-January 3, 2025); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Nineteenth Congress in 2024.

asset.name: L000605_001
